<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[210, 100, 550, 115]]<|/det|> # Cambridge International Examinations <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[210, 118, 760, 131]]<|/det|> Cambridge International Advanced Subsidiary and Advanced Level <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 172, 194, 199]]<|/det|> CANDIDATE NAME <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 222, 170, 248]]<|/det|> CENTRE NUMBER <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[210, 214, 422, 258]]<|/det|>
<|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[617, 214, 905, 258]]<|/det|>
CANDIDATE
NUMBER
<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 280, 171, 291]]<|/det|> # PHYSICS <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 300, 363, 312]]<|/det|> Paper 3 Advanced Practical Skills 1 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 339, 415, 351]]<|/det|> Candidates answer on the Question Paper. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 359, 584, 371]]<|/det|> Additional Materials: As listed in the Confidential Instructions. <|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 392, 388, 404]]<|/det|> # READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 718, 431]]<|/det|> Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 433, 330, 445]]<|/det|> Write in dark blue or black pen. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 448, 500, 460]]<|/det|> You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 462, 504, 474]]<|/det|> Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 476, 380, 488]]<|/det|> DO **NOT** WRITE IN ANY BARCODES. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 503, 275, 514]]<|/det|> Answer **both** questions. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 517, 780, 529]]<|/det|> You will be allowed to work with the apparatus for a maximum of one hour for each question. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 532, 904, 558]]<|/det|> You are expected to record all your observations as soon as these observations are made, and to plan the presentation of the records so that it is not necessary to make a fair copy of them. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 560, 740, 572]]<|/det|> You are reminded of the need for good English and clear presentation in your answers. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 586, 359, 597]]<|/det|> Electronic calculators may be used. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 600, 767, 612]]<|/det|> You may lose marks if you do not show your working or if you do not use appropriate units. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 626, 805, 638]]<|/det|> Additional answer paper and graph paper should be used only if it becomes necessary to do so. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 652, 605, 663]]<|/det|> At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 666, 758, 678]]<|/det|> The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question. <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[682, 720, 904, 848]]<|/det|>
For Examiner's Use
1
2
Total
<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[332, 876, 663, 888]]<|/det|> This document consists of 12 printed pages.

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[260, 73, 737, 90]]<|/det|>
# You may not need to use all of the materials provided.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 104, 96, 122]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 104, 650, 121]]<|/det|>
In this experiment, you will investigate the oscillations of a mass.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 135, 148, 153]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 135, 507, 152]]<|/det|>
Set up the apparatus as shown in Fig. 1.1.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[222, 167, 792, 477]]<|/det|>
<center>Fig. 1.1</center>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 533, 730, 549]]<|/det|>
• Hang mass M from the string loop near the end of the metre rule.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 565, 917, 596]]<|/det|>
• Ensure that the metre rule is pushing up against the rod of clamp A at approximately the 24 cm mark.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 611, 917, 642]]<|/det|>
• The distance between the rod of clamp A and the string attached to the spring is \(d\). Adjust the position of the stand holding the spring so that \(d\) is approximately 30 cm.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 657, 917, 688]]<|/det|>
• Adjust the height of the clamps until the rule is horizontal. Ensure that the spring is vertical.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 704, 384, 718]]<|/det|>
• Measure and record \(d\).

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[555, 733, 915, 750]]<|/det|>
\[d = \ldots \ldots \ldots \ldots \ldots \ldots \ldots \ldots \ldots \ldots \ldots \ldots \ldots \ldots \ldots \quad (1)\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 765, 800, 781]]<|/det|>
• The distance between the rod of clamp A and the string supporting M is \(s\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 796, 384, 810]]<|/det|>
Measure and record \(s\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[556, 827, 915, 842]]<|/det|>
<form>s = ............................................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 842, 920, 859]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 75, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[168, 75, 507, 92]]<|/det|>
• Pull M down through a short distance.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 106, 447, 122]]<|/det|>
• Release M so that it oscillates.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 136, 558, 153]]<|/det|>
• Determine the period \(T\) of these oscillations.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[555, 338, 918, 355]]<|/det|>
<form>T = ........................................................................ [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 370, 146, 388]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 370, 920, 402]]<|/det|>
• Without moving the stands, slide the rule horizontally through the string loop so that \(d\) remains constant but \(s\) changes.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 416, 918, 448]]<|/det|>
• Adjust the height of the clamps until the rule is horizontal. Ensure that the spring is vertical.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 462, 383, 478]]<|/det|>
• Measure and record \(s\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[556, 508, 917, 523]]<|/det|>
<form>s = ........................................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 539, 292, 555]]<|/det|>
• Repeat (b).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[556, 740, 917, 756]]<|/det|>
<form>T = ...........................................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[893, 757, 920, 774]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 73, 148, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 918, 106]]<|/det|>
Vary \(s\) and repeat **(c)** until you have five sets of values of \(s\) and \(T\). You may include your previous sets of readings.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 119, 687, 136]]<|/det|>
Record your results in a table. Include values of \(T^2\) in your table.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 447, 920, 465]]<|/det|>
<mark>[9]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 477, 144, 495]]<|/det|>
<label>(e)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 477, 180, 495]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 477, 650, 495]]<|/det|>
Plot a graph of \(T^2\) on the \(y\)-axis against \(s\) on the \(x\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 477, 920, 495]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 508, 180, 526]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 508, 457, 526]]<|/det|>
Draw the straight line of best fit.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 508, 920, 526]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 540, 180, 558]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 540, 607, 558]]<|/det|>
Determine the gradient and \(y\)-intercept of this line.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[497, 774, 915, 790]]<|/det|>
<form>gradient = ............................................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[475, 806, 915, 822]]<|/det|>
<form>y-intercept = ............................................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 822, 920, 840]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[260, 73, 737, 90]]<|/det|>
# You may not need to use all of the materials provided.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 103, 96, 122]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 103, 667, 121]]<|/det|>
In this experiment, you will investigate the oscillations of a magnet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 135, 146, 153]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 135, 514, 152]]<|/det|>
You have been provided with a metal plate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 165, 808, 183]]<|/det|>
Use tape to secure the plate at the edge of the bench as shown in Fig. 2.1.  

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[292, 196, 703, 395]]<|/det|>
<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[465, 418, 532, 437]]<|/det|>
<center>Fig. 2.1 </center>  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 450, 917, 484]]<|/det|>
Use more tape to secure one of the paper strips to the bench so that it covers the plate, as shown in Fig. 2.2.  

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[244, 526, 755, 640]]<|/det|>
<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[465, 660, 534, 677]]<|/det|>
<center>Fig. 2.2 </center>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 678, 90]]<|/det|>
<pre>You have been provided with a bar magnet attached to a string.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 104, 185, 121]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[195, 104, 544, 121]]<|/det|>
Set up the apparatus as shown in Fig. 2.3.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[265, 134, 730, 454]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[465, 477, 533, 495]]<|/det|>
<center>Fig. 2.3</center>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 510, 175, 527]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 510, 917, 542]]<|/det|>
The distance between the bottom of the split cork and the bottom of the magnet should be approximately 55 cm.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 558, 175, 575]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 558, 917, 590]]<|/det|>
The distance between the bottom of the magnet and the paper strip is \(x\). Adjust the height of the magnet so that \(x\) is approximately 3 mm.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 604, 175, 621]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 604, 383, 619]]<|/det|>
Measure and record \(x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[555, 717, 917, 733]]<|/det|>
<form>x = ............................................................ [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 75, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 75, 918, 108]]<|/det|>
• Move the stand until the magnet hangs with one edge vertically above line A, as shown in Fig. 2.4.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[215, 123, 783, 218]]<|/det|>
<center>Fig. 2.4</center>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 269, 178, 287]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 269, 918, 303]]<|/det|>
Pull the magnet to the right, keeping the string straight, until the same edge of the magnet is above line B, as shown in Fig. 2.5.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[215, 313, 781, 377]]<|/det|>
<center>Fig. 2.5</center>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 428, 180, 446]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 428, 580, 446]]<|/det|>
Release the magnet. The magnet will oscillate.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 460, 180, 478]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 460, 918, 492]]<|/det|>
Draw a line on the paper at the position of the edge of the magnet after 30 complete oscillations.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 507, 180, 524]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 507, 683, 524]]<|/det|>
Label this line C. The distance BC is \(y\) as shown in Fig. 2.6.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[279, 536, 715, 610]]<|/det|>
<center>Fig. 2.6</center>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 664, 384, 682]]<|/det|>
<pre>• Measure and record \(y\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[554, 835, 918, 853]]<|/det|>
<form>y = ........................................................................... [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 146, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>(g)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 73, 180, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 73, 904, 90]]<|/det|>
Describe four sources of uncertainty or limitations of the procedure for this experiment.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 104, 915, 120]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 165, 915, 180]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 288, 915, 303]]<|/det|>
